intro: Calacinum complexum, commonly known as the moonflower vine, is a tropical plant characterized by its large, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is native to the humid regions of Central and South America. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces long, trailing stems that can climb or trail along the ground. Its flowers, which open at dusk and close at dawn, are typically white or pale lavender in color. The botanical structure of Calacinum complexum includes a fibrous root system and a woody stem with prominent veins.
